content:
Hello, I just tried to install Lean4 online in the GitPod cloud. I cloned the mathlib4 repo, but when I rund Lean on any file in the library, it says

error: unknown package 'Mathlib'
You might need to open '/workspace/mathlib4' as a workspace in your editor

I found this ressource, where they recommend running lake build in the root folder, which I did and which ran without error, but I still can't compile any files in the Mathlib. Any ideas?

What do you mean by

I just tried to install Lean4 online in the GitPod cloud.
Did you just open (not clone) the https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4 repo in gitpod?
Yes, that's what i did! True, it's not a clone, sorry...
it doesnt throw an error but when i do e.g. lean Mathlib/Algebra/Group/Basic.lean i get an error...
Well don't write that, use lake build Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Basic instead
Klaus Gy has marked this topic as resolved.
so never use lean in the command line?
Not any more (unless you're a developer). That was a lean 3 thing
